result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:13 PM (64-06) Defendant Wayne J Bigelow in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Wayne J Bigelow.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness Jennifer Funk, Delavan Police Department.
Jennifer Funk sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Berg.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
Witness has identified the defendant in court. 
2:16PM - Cross examination by Attorney Uzowulu.
Evidence is closed.
2:17PM - Argument by the State. Requesting bind over.
No argument by the defense.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Uzoulu acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all counts on behalf of his client.
Speedy reserved.

Adj. 2:19PM
Adj. 2:18PM
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wayne J Bigelow in court. Attorney Obi Uzowulu. Address updated. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.B. dob 1-19-1964 or K.L.W. dob 11-9-1991. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Wayne J Bigelow in court, in custody by video. SPD needs one week to appoint. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

The original document was titled: Notice of Arrest
The original history event date is: 08-08-2022
